examples: Every age has its book, after all.
Boys his age are a law unto themselves.
Reckless youth makes rueful age.
His parents have not yet reached retirement age.
My parents came of age during the 1960s.
words.defineEn: a period of history identified with a particular event
words.defineVi: một giai đoạn lịch sử được xác định với một sự kiện cụ thể

examples: She placed a calendar on the wall to keep track of important dates.

I need to check my calendar to see if I'm available on that date.
Here's a calendar.
Mark your calendars.
words.defineEn: ‌a system that measures and divides the year into specified periods
words.defineVi: ‌một hệ thống đo lường và chia năm thành các khoảng thời gian xác định

examples: Programs are running a few minutes behind schedule this evening.

The meeting is scheduled to start at half past nine, which is thirty minutes from now.
He felt a sharp pain in his tooth and scheduled a dental appointment.
The regulations are scheduled to go into effect next winter, and in the interim, we'll be working hard to make all of the appropriate changes.
words.defineEn: to set a specific time to do something or make an event happen
words.defineVi: để thiết lập một thời gian cụ thể để làm một cái gì đó hoặc làm cho một sự kiện xảy ra

examples: A new era had begun.
The old painting depicted a picturesque landscape from a bygone era.
We are on the threshold of a new era in global relations.
Every era had some imprint on comedy and popular culture.
Each concentric sphere is an era.
words.defineEn: a period of history marked by particular features or events
words.defineVi: một giai đoạn lịch sử được đánh dấu bằng các tính năng hoặc sự kiện cụ thể

examples: The committee meets once a fortnight.
We have a man who comes in and cuts the grass once a fortnight.
Huge games like Fortnight or Call of Duty or World of Warcraft are created by organizational behemoths with massive budgets and scores of employees.
Some of the most popular games like Minecraft and Fortnight can run on your phone without a console.
While there are absolutely popular nonviolent games, undeniably violent games like Call of Duty, Counter-Strike, PUBG and Fortnight continue to be hugely successful.
words.defineEn: a period consisting of two weeks or 14 days
words.defineVi: một khoảng thời gian bao gồm hai tuần hoặc 14 ngày

examples: Tell them you didn't have eyes for something that needed two millennia to achieve and I'll take it all back.
McDonald's fries will last a millennium.
In the first millennium, a large group of tribes spread through the dense woodlands of Eastern Europe.
It took nearly a millennium until Jericho, probably the first city on Earth, was founded in the year 1000 after the start of the human era.
By the first millennium BCE, apples had become part of Western agriculture.
words.defineEn: a period of 1000 years, usually calculated from the year of the birth of Jesus Christ
words.defineVi: khoảng thời gian 1000 năm, thường được tính từ năm Chúa Giêsu giáng sinh

examples: The committee divided the earth into 24 time zones.
Each time zone was equal to one hour of time in a 24-hour day.
Today the time zone system is used by most countries of the world.
There are 24 broad time zones worldwide, each one hour apart.
We travel to different time zones, different countries.
words.defineEn: any of the regions that are divided according to their longitude, each having a specific standard time
words.defineVi: bất kỳ khu vực nào được phân chia theo kinh độ của chúng, mỗi khu vực có một giờ tiêu chuẩn cụ thể

words.defineEn: to happen or be done later than it should have
words.defineVi: xảy ra hoặc được thực hiện muộn hơn nó nên có

examples: As a result, people in different locations had different local times.

They did not match the local time.
They set their watches to their own local time at the start of a trip.
U.S. officials say the president's meetings with Putin and Russian officials are expected to start around 1:00 p.m. local time.
words.defineEn: the standard time measured in a specific region
words.defineVi: thời gian tiêu chuẩn được đo trong một khu vực cụ thể

examples: The accuracy, the chronometer, the timing, it's all about telling the right time, keeping the right time.
So, eventually, people came up with a mechanical timepiece called a chronometer to figure out longitude.

Thank you for your support on Patreon.com/crashcourse it wasn’t until the eighteenth century development of the chronometer that sailors could chart longitudinal location, and even now, GPS relies on an extremely precise knowledge of the time.
words.defineEn: a timepiece that shows the time in a very exact way, especially one used at sea
words.defineVi: một chiếc đồng hồ hiển thị thời gian một cách rất chính xác, đặc biệt là một chiếc đồng hồ được sử dụng trên biển

examples: Hourglasses worked in a similar way.

The zip-up hoodie was designed with front pockets to hide any stomach pooch and cut with an hourglass shape to nip in your waist.
words.defineEn: a glass container with two parts that measures every sixty minutes using the sand flow from the upper to the lower part
words.defineVi: một hộp thủy tinh có hai phần đo sáu mươi phút một lần bằng cách sử dụng dòng cát từ phần trên xuống phần dưới

examples: One was Dutch natural philosopher Christiaan Huygens, who’s famous for many things, including the pendulum clock.
words.defineEn: a type of clock that works using a swinging weight at the end of a straight line
words.defineVi: một loại đồng hồ hoạt động bằng cách sử dụng quả nặng đung đưa ở cuối một đường thẳng

examples: He clicked the stopwatch and recorded his time: 45 seconds.

When you stop breathing in and eating Carbon 14, it’s like starting a chemical stopwatch.
Once you dose everyone, turn them lose in the maze and wait at the other end with a stopwatch.
words.defineEn: a watch with a button to stop and start time, used in sport events
words.defineVi: đồng hồ có nút để dừng và bắt đầu thời gian, được sử dụng trong các sự kiện thể thao

examples: Sundials could measure time on sunny days.
Sundials could measure time on sunny days.
Later, round sundials were developed.
Later, round sundials were developed.
And sundials kind of automatically do this!
words.defineEn: an instrument used in the past to tell the time using the shadow made by a metal piece on a flat stone
words.defineVi: một nhạc cụ được sử dụng trong quá khứ để xem thời gian bằng cách sử dụng bóng được tạo bởi một miếng kim loại trên một hòn đá phẳng

examples: Twilight had not yet come.

Below the sunlight zone, there’s the twilight zone.
In this transition zone between twilight and darkness, light becomes a powerful tool.
Generally, you can only see satellites overhead during astronomical twilight, when the Sun is 12 to 18 degrees below the horizon, and for an hour or so at the start and end of the night.
words.defineEn: the time in the evening when the sun is below the horizon
words.defineVi: thời gian vào buổi tối khi mặt trời ở dưới đường chân trời

examples: His constant lateness was really starting to eat into their friendship.
[WAH-WAH-WAH] I don't particularly care the lateness, especially on a first date.
words.defineEn: the fact or quality of arriving, happening, or being done after the usual or expected time
words.defineVi: thực tế hoặc chất lượng của việc đến, xảy ra hoặc được thực hiện sau thời gian thông thường hoặc dự kiến

examples: The concept of a kid's mental age is essentially the level of performance associated with a certain chronological age.

If we can keep it as chronological as possible they can actually follow along.
And rather than describing his life events in chronological order, he jumps between times and places.
At the time, your IQ was simply your mental age, divided by your chronological age, multiplied by a hundred.
words.defineEn: organized according to the order that the events occurred in
words.defineVi: sắp xếp theo thứ tự các sự kiện xảy ra trong

examples: Be patient and trust in the process, rather than seeking instant gratification.

Every day, 290 million people eat instant noodles.
words.defineEn: happening or produced very quickly and easily
words.defineVi: xảy ra hoặc sản xuất rất nhanh chóng và dễ dàng

examples: Her recent conduct is beyond the pale.

The relationship between the two friends had deteriorated beyond repair.
words.defineEn: to or at the side that is further
words.defineVi: đến hoặc ở bên đó là xa hơn

examples: Yet, for the moment anyway, the bankers have lost their Midas touch.

words.defineEn: at the present time, until something happens; for now

words.defineVi: một lần trong năm; hàng năm
